item.description:
This is a beautiful hike along Lake Zoar in Newtown, CT. Approx. 3 miles total. This trail has a lot of hills and valleys, so be prepared for a leg workout! There are many great views of the lake along the way. You'll also see an old foundation, the old "rope swing", and a couple "secret" beaches! The trail begins at the end of Great Quarter Rd in Newtown and we will be taking it to a natural waterfall. There is a perfect picnic spot at the waterfall, so feel free to pack a sandwich or something to much on!

*****************************Just some last minute details***********************

Great Quarter Rd is located right off of Route 34 near the junction of 111 and 34. Take Great Quarter Rd until it is a dead end. I'll be there early in a dark grey Honda, I'll try to put some sort of "sign" on it to eliminate confusion ;)

If you feel that you are going to arrive after 1:00, please call my cell phone (listed below) so that I know to wait for you. Also call if you have ANY questions or concerns. See you out there!!!

Amanda (203) 209-7779
backup cell phone (203) 515-3428

item.name: The Waterfall Hike at Lake Zoar
